snippet.textDisplay: I've not played the xenoblade series yet , but as soon as I heard this track, I knew it was composed by Sawano. I get a very AoT/ Aldnoah zero vibe from the powerful drums and vocal chorus. Hopefully we'll be seeing more of hiroyuki sawano' s tracks  in other japanese games.
snippet.textOriginal: I've not played the xenoblade series yet , but as soon as I heard this track, I knew it was composed by Sawano. I get a very AoT/ Aldnoah zero vibe from the powerful drums and vocal chorus. Hopefully we'll be seeing more of hiroyuki sawano' s tracks  in other japanese games.

snippet.textDisplay: This is what Adventure means. Xenoblade is the ultimate epic, meant for players who love being immersed within the game, exploring vast landscapes and engaging in intense real-time combat, of course complete with a fantastic mind-blowing story-line... and the fact that Hiroyuki Sawano is the main music composer in X is just amazing.
snippet.textOriginal: This is what Adventure means. Xenoblade is the ultimate epic, meant for players who love being immersed within the game, exploring vast landscapes and engaging in intense real-time combat, of course complete with a fantastic mind-blowing story-line... and the fact that Hiroyuki Sawano is the main music composer in X is just amazing.

snippet.textDisplay: Hiroyaki Sawano has quickly become one of my favorite anime composers (he has worked on Attack on Titan, Kill la Kill and Gundam Unicorn) and it's exciting to see him composing for a game. This sounds very characteristic of his work.
snippet.textOriginal: Hiroyaki Sawano has quickly become one of my favorite anime composers (he has worked on Attack on Titan, Kill la Kill and Gundam Unicorn) and it's exciting to see him composing for a game. This sounds very characteristic of his work.

snippet.textDisplay:
The only reason The Last Story or Brawl wasn't my favorite game of the last generation is because Xenoblade Chronicles exist. It took me over 90 hours before I finished the main story and I loved pretty much every moment of it.

This game already looks great and if it's even close to the first one it will be amazing. I do need to say that it looks like a new Final Fantasy though.
snippet.textOriginal:
The only reason The Last Story or Brawl wasn't my favorite game of the last generation is because Xenoblade Chronicles exist. It took me over 90 hours before I finished the main story and I loved pretty much every moment of it.

This game already looks great and if it's even close to the first one it will be amazing. I do need to say that it looks like a new Final Fantasy though.

snippet.textDisplay: I am really looking forward to this game coming out.  I still need to get back to playing the first game because i have been stuck at a particular boss. This "main theme" is definitely an incredible start to what i hope to be a great soundtrack.

snippet.textDisplay: Try switching to rayne! You can let #1 heal you, while Shulk casts the menado and you beat the living crap out of him! Been stuck for abouta month untill I tried this ^_^

snippet.textDisplay: While I prefer the beautiful and somber tone of the original's main theme, this one has a pretty epic feeling which fits well with the game's futuristic motif. While the original had robots, they were more confined to a lot of tribal settings. The sequel to me feels like a mesh of Star Ocean and Gundam.
snippet.textOriginal: While I prefer the beautiful and somber tone of the original's main theme, this one has a pretty epic feeling which fits well with the game's futuristic motif. While the original had robots, they were more confined to a lot of tribal settings. The sequel to me feels like a mesh of Star Ocean and Gundam.

snippet.textDisplay: A lot of Hiroyuki Sawano's songs consist of two contrasting halves like that.  It's just his style.  I'm really looking forward to seeing how the full soundtrack turns out.
snippet.textOriginal: A lot of Hiroyuki Sawano's songs consist of two contrasting halves like that.  It's just his style.  I'm really looking forward to seeing how the full soundtrack turns out.

snippet.textDisplay: @zeerinianu Its a story of survival, its quiet like space, the earth, our home was destroyed, the future uncertain, the second half, the glorious rebuilding of civillization on the grand scale of an alien world against the odds of an expanding intergalactic war.
snippet.textOriginal: @zeerinianu Its a story of survival, its quiet like space, the earth, our home was destroyed, the future uncertain, the second half, the glorious rebuilding of civillization on the grand scale of an alien world against the odds of an expanding intergalactic war.

snippet.textDisplay: Maybe I'm weird, but I actually like the sudden shift. To me, the first half of the song seems rather melancholic, but then all of a sudden the second, hopeful half bursts into scene in a pretty powerful way. Definitely two distinct halves, but I think it works.
snippet.textOriginal: Maybe I'm weird, but I actually like the sudden shift. To me, the first half of the song seems rather melancholic, but then all of a sudden the second, hopeful half bursts into scene in a pretty powerful way. Definitely two distinct halves, but I think it works.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm really looking forward to this game. I've beaten Xenoblade and I'm doing a second playthrough now to get myself ready for this game. This game looks great with the mechs and how open the world is and the music so far is wonderful. I can't wait till it releases in 2015.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm really looking forward to this game. I've beaten Xenoblade and I'm doing a second playthrough now to get myself ready for this game. This game looks great with the mechs and how open the world is and the music so far is wonderful. I can't wait till it releases in 2015.

snippet.textDisplay: The latest footage presented during yesterday's Nintendo Direct was certainly great looking. There's a part where it feels like the character is jumping around a city straight out of Grand Theft Auto! This theme was made available on the game's official site, I'm assuming it's the Main Theme but I'm not sure it's been confirmed. The first Xenoblade was already a huge game and they said this will be even bigger. Exciting!
snippet.textOriginal: The latest footage presented during yesterday's Nintendo Direct was certainly great looking. There's a part where it feels like the character is jumping around a city straight out of Grand Theft Auto! This theme was made available on the game's official site, I'm assuming it's the Main Theme but I'm not sure it's been confirmed. The first Xenoblade was already a huge game and they said this will be even bigger. Exciting!
